answers.answer: Demerol is a narcotic pain reliever. Headache IS listed as a known, possible side effect.Phenergan is an anti-nausea drug (often given with Demerol because Demerol frequently causing nausea and vomiting). Headache is not listed as a known side effectTerbutaline is a bronchodilator. Headache is listed as a known possible side effect.Terbutaline is fast acting and doesn't stick around for long but I know from personal experience that Demerol and its side effects can stick around for a few days.Dilaudid is another narcotic pain med...and a known side effect is headache.When you see your doctor, ask if he/she will give you Stadol. It does NOT have headache as a side effect :) Unfortunately, it is given by injection...But if your headache isn't going away, it might be worth it...IF your doctor will give it to you.Most narcotic pain relievers have headache as a possible side effect :(Blood pressure....Yes, pain can cause an increase in BP. In fact, clinical nurses look at pulse and BP when people come in complaining of severe pain. If someone has a normal BP and pulse and wants narcs...it is a pretty safe bet that they are med seeking.I hope your headache resolves very soon (((hug))) Try accupressure, a warm compress/heating pad to the back of the neck, a long hot bath or shower...and of course watch your BP.

I am someone who is very sensitive to medication.  Any time I have been given a narcotic pain reliever, I am left with a headache.  Christine gave you great info and great advice.  I hope you feel better soon.

If any of the drugs were administered in the spine, and they accidentally pierced thru the epidural space, you may have a spinal headache. Do you feel better lying flat? This happened to me after I delivered my first baby. It will heal itself in about 7-10 days if that's what happened to you.

I still have my headache but I can say on a scale of 1-10 its about a 3-4, still much better.I went for a follow up today at my OB doc, and he said they should not have given me terbutaline because it rises blood pressure as well... HELLO---- I have high blood pressure!! and I told them the medication I was taking along with the dosage, But it was the on call doc that made that decision. Combined with all the other stuff they gave me,I am not a medicine take so I am always asking what that, what is that for, how much are you given me.And if the wind blows hard I get a headache, that's a sensitive part on my body.But Thank God, I am coming around, he still has me on bedrest though
I am very glad you are feeling better. I hope your headache goes away completely very soon.I'm with your OB on the terbutaline...not sure why they gave you a bronchodilator anyway...
terbutaline can also be used to stop premature labor.
So they did check you for preeclampsia and HELLP??  They checked your urine protein levels?  And did a full blood workup?  How far along are you?
Yep, I was cleared from HELLP and preeclampsia. Urine and blood work all came back good. I made 35 vweeks today. I have to do a 2e4 hr urine starting Sunday and bring it in to my doctor appt.

I always get headach even before pg.When I was around 36 week, my feet were swollen, and get more headach and back pain which I believe all pg women should have it.  I ask for the HELLP and preeclampsia test my OB said I should not need one however she still ordered the blood draw. All test came back normal.  Couple days later my shoulder hurt also and I thought I was clear on HELLP and preeclampsia so nothing to worry, but I was wrong.  When I was 37 week, I could not stand for the headach, I rush to ER and my blood preasure got up to 192, with swollen feet, shoulder pain, eye blurry......no need test for preeclampsia....they rush to take my baby out.  In the mean while, the test come back and they said I got preeclampsia......it was just couple days apart.  They keep me on the delivery room for 2 days and nurse sit next to me 24 hr/day to make sure I would not get stroke even after delivery.  Close monitor me 24 hr after birth (nurse always sit right next to me 24 hr/day....not monitor me fr distance) So keep an eye on the symptom, the blood work may not detect it just a few day earlier.Take care.

question: Okay, I  went to ER sat evening for back pain. Turns out I was having contractions 2-7 minutes apart. They gave me demerol, phenergan and terbutaline, I was very woozy of course. they stopped the contractions and released me.Sunday morning I woke up with a severe headache(scale of 1-10 it was a 10), I waited a few hrs I thought maybe it would go away, it never did. It hurt when I yarned, talkd or even moved my head. Finally I called the ER an I asked them could the meds they gave me have this side affect she said no. But mind you I didnt have a headache before  I went to the ER sat. I called my on call doctor he asked what my bp was at the time it was 146/97, I do take bp medicine so he advise that I take another one. Okay I did that.The pain was still there. I went back to the ER sun. BP was good, but my head was killing me, they gave me a another pain med Dalutted or something like that,  it brought my pain from a 10 to a 8, They released me.Well, had my follow up appt with my doctor on yesterday, my head was still hurting, barely could move. He told me to go back to ER-LD, and he was going to run tests for Hellp syndrome,m and a list of others. All tests came back good. Because if they didnt he told me he was going to admitt me for bedrest or delivery. When my doctor came tp talk to me before releasing from the hospital, he said he dont know about these headaches, and he said he is wondering if it could be a "hangover" from all those meds.Well I am at home on bedrest, head is still not normal. I have to go see him again in the am.My question is1: Do you believe the cocktail of all those meds rhey gave me sat caused this, ifso how long would it take to wear all the way off.2. Do you believe that the reason my pressure was up some because of the pain, does nt pain sometimes cause a rise in pressure.
title: Anybody, Somebody Please..
